definition:
Let $R[G]$ be the group ring of a group $G$ over a ring $R$.

Let $x = \sum_g x_g g$ be an element of $R[G]$. The *support* of $x$,
often written ${\operatorname{supp}}(x)$, is the set of elements of $G$
which occur with non-zero coefficient in the expansion of $x$.

Thus: $${\operatorname{supp}}(x) = \{ g \in G \mid x_g \neq 0 \}.$$
